p: Analyses of the organic acids of pomegranate aril juice have shown that citric acid is generally the predominant organic acid and its content can reach up to 3.76 g/100 g in the juice. In addition, it contains significantly lower levels of malic, oxalic, succinic, tartaric, and ascorbic acids ( Table 1). In the fruit peel, citric acid is the predominant organic acid and its content can reach up to 1.68 g/100 g. Smaller amounts of malic, succinic, and oxalic acid were also detected in peels.
